name: Spain
takeaway: Spain continues to be the most friendly European country towards the PRC, still extraditing or attempting to extradite citizens there, implementing the "one China principle" and not questioning the human rights situation in the PRC. Technologies that are being questioned by the EU or the US, are still mostly in place in Spain with PRC-connected entities.
Overall, journalists and media outlets present a critical view regarding the situation in the PRC especially thanks to the presence of Spanish correspondents there.
Political leaders at the local and national level, as well as academia in general, seem to be more open to cooperate with the PRC on exchanges and research.
description-1: In 2023, Spain had a GDP per capita of US$32,677 with a total population of 47.91 million people, of which 224,559 are Chinese.
description-2: Spain established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1973. Spain was ranked 30th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 90/100.

Media.evidence: Business Insider Spain and Forbes reported that TikTok displayed ads from Chinese state media in Europe, including Spain, to promote Xinjiang, despite its controversial human rights record.
